captions.text:
Hey Vsauce I'm Jake and I am currently in
Amsterdam devouring Kinder Surprise, which

is a chocolate egg with a toy inside. And
its banned in the United States, not because

anyone has choked on the prize, but because
it is illegal for any food product to be sold

in the US with something non edible completely
in it. If you ever need more random info there

is Fact Slides which tells you things like
natural gas is odorless, the smell is added

artificially for safety reasons. But instead
of a random fact, why not a random youtube

comment .com. Now lets write in the water
and check out more things you can do online
now, guys...DONG

Solar System Scope is an incredibly cool website
where you navigate the solar system. You can

explore all the planets, find out facts about
them, look at their individual layers and

simulate their orbits. You can also see a
map of the constellations and have them correspond

to your current location and direction on
Earth.

Then shape your world with this Terrain editor.
Adjust the brush, texture and material to

create something unique. And what kind of
world would it be without Snow...Box. A tool

that lets you build a snowman or really whatever
snowthing your lil heart desires. Once your

creation is complete, sit back and relax with
a 360 degree Aurora Borealis.

When it becomes daylight, ask yourself Why
is the Sky Blue? an informative explanation

as to how particles in our atmosphere affect
the color we see. For more colors drop an

MP3 into this visualizer... 
then be like Neon Night Crawler with FastKat
a game where you control a spaceship through

an endless asteroid belt. Avoid running into
any of them as the ship starts to go faster

and faster however, it isn't the Fastest thing
on Earth. That honor goes to the Apollo 10

which travelled at 24,816 mph on it's return
from the Moon ... the fastest man has ever

traveled. The graph shows you other speed
records as well, but you can just set your

own with the most realistic driving simulator
ever made.

Night Rider Turbo. Grab the wheel and...oops...i
must not know my own strength... It's ok kids

let me just hit the brake...and it broke.
I'll just shift into another gear...no. NO!

Curse my amazingly strong upper body! Well...nothing
to do but wait for the eventual

Typocolypse...3D a game where the faster you
type, the more zombies you'll annihilate.

There are different power ups like land mines,
slow motion and a some sniping. If they're

not impressed with your words per minute,
hack them to bits with this hacker typer that

has different themes for the terminal like
Umbrella Corporation, Black Mesa or Aperture

Science. Then learn some new old words with
Lexican, a lexicon of forgotten words, so

when you meet a pettifogger you can tell them
that you're a tziganologist and watch their
confusion *kench*. *apodyopsis*

Use Llama Font to make those words stand out
even more but, instead of having to use your

words, be like DragonOme and draw it out with
this Sketch Toy.

Just be careful when drawing, you wouldn't
want any Human Error, an interactive infographic

that gives the brief history of certain events
caused by human error.

If you're feeling Wild at Heart, use a chrome
plug-in that changes every image to one of

Nicolas Cage. Or maybe you'd prefer an infinite
amount of Cages, because he is a National
Treasure.

For some reason if you get sick of looking
at Nicolas Cage, and all actors, take their

Face Off with Invisibles, where you guess
the movie using one image with the lead erased
from it.

Then check out these moire images that create
the illusion of movement, and if you need

real movement there's Launchball, a really
fun and challenging game by the Science Museum.

You have to get the ball to the goal using
a variety of different tools.

Celebrate your success with a slice of Banana
Bread, a 3D first person shooter in your web

browser. You can battle with bots or join
a match with other players online. It is a

proof of concept so it has some bugs but is
still really fun.

To find out what part of North America your
manner of speaking fits into, take the dialect

quiz. After getting the answer, gather a group
of people who speak similarly and y'all can

play Capture The Flag, a multiplayer version
of the classic game that has traps and lots
of body popping.

While doing these DONGs, I made a new JAM,
a new Just Awesome Music playlist for you

over on WEsauce so you can have that playing
in the background. I'll have it playing while

eating my 50th Kinder. I have an addiction.
And as always, thanks for watching

comments.text:
Being coached by Ed Scrobe has taught me what a coach does, how he treats 
his athletes and goes the extra mile for each, regardless of their skill 
level. Much of my success, as a coach, judge, teacher, and person is due to 
Ed Scrobe. When Ed coached, there was always excitement and enthusiasm in 
the gym, a feeling you could, you would learn the skill, Ed was always 
positive. When we travelled and there were no heat on the bus, Ed said part 
of the fun of gymnastics is the travel, no matter what.
-Kenneth Achiron﻿
